reviews.review:
Portal 2 is a puzzle based game. The point of this game is to shoot portals to solve varieties of puzzles. I really enjoyed playing this game. The puzzles and game mechanics are so well made. Some of the puzzles are difficult to solve but it didn't stop me from having fun from this game. It had a lot of unique obstacles that will make our journey more challenging. I really like how the game took us step by step to learn the patterns of problem solving before getting into more hard to solve rooms. Also this game has a lot of easter eggs and an interesting backstory that you can only figure out by research. The character in this game such as GLaDOS and Wheatley are also comical and it kept me entertained. 

The other thing i really like about this game is that when you play it, you will feel like you're in this really huge space, wondering is this giant laboratory actually endless, it's really massive and you will feel so small and overwhelmed.

The only thing that bugs me is that i can only play max 1--2 hours a day of this game because it's very immersive so you will feel VERY DIZZY. I felt nauseous and wanting to vomit a few times.

One last thing, the ending was 100% worth it.

So yes! i approve this game!!! :)

this is game is really good for not bieng bored of lockdown 

100% recommended
Сюжет не зашел, а кооп хороший. Да.
It's fun to play and logical. In that way you can learn the game and don't have to guess at solutions.

Seriously one of the best games of all time, played through this 2 times plus multiplayer is really fun, even if you and the other player aren't the smartest of people. the graphics and attention to detail are amazing, and each of the mechanics tie in nicely to the story and with each other. Whilst its not a grand story, it is still quite intriguing and some of the humour is great, even by today's standards. So worth the money.

Seriously valve pls Portal 3

Although I'm several years late to maing a review of this game, having played the original Portal back in 2008 I really fell for the whole game and its concept. This game took what was already there and expanded it in a way that really makes for interesting and challenging puzzles. Playing in  the 2-player cooperative mode was so much fun because we kept failing and finding the solution together in such a way that it shows how rewarding the gameplay can be both at the single player level as well as the cooperative gameplay.
Obra maestra, nada más que decir.
